artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Kazusaya Iwazō
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 1; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), p. 4–5 no. 1, p. 300.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: three separate sheets; saturated color; underwater scene; figure at L riddled with arrows and blood standing in front of large brown rock, wielding sword; figure at C sinking in water, with arrows in body, sinking toward crabs at bottom; family in robes at R seated on rock, looking on; figure in foreground with swords, bloody, charging to L
dimension: 14 × 9 5/8 in. (35.56 × 24.45 cm) (image, sheet, each panel; vertical oban triptych)
markings: Artist’s seal: 芳桐 {Yoshikiri} | Censor seals: 福 {Fuku} / 村松 {Muramatsu} / 丑六
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
signed: 一魁斎芳年筆 {Ikkaisai Yoshitoshi hitsu}
title: Picture of the Heike Clan Sinking and Perishing at Sea
